question: Yeah. Never opened her up. Who was the girl who kicked me in the head yesterday?
answer: Look, I'll be honest with you. Most of us realized we didn't have a whore's chance in heaven with Jack the day of candidate speeches. It was the first time most of us even heard Jack speak.

question: Whoa...Thanks, uh - WOW. Uh, hey, alright...okay, uh --
answer: We weren't disappointed.

question: Guys! Hey, guys! Shut up a minute. Well, uh, I think it just really rocks that the football team picked me as their, y'know, uh, candidate. Hey, well, I love you lunch ladies! I just want to say that there are only three things I want in life - to someday become a senator of this great state... I want to lead the Lincoln High Fightin' Logs to victory at the homecoming game -- Okay, okay... Uh, and I... I want to go to the homecoming dance with Diane Weston.
answer: Ucht! They were like friggin' Barbie and Ken, but without the pink, remote control Corvette. Overnight people were going, like -- "Oh, they're the perfect couple!" "They're so cuuuuuuuuute!" I'm sure it gave the internet whacks something to talk about besides Agent Scully and their most recent wet dream. Now, I'm not one to gossip, but I think Jack and Diane got so close so fast because they discovered how much they both loved...

question: Hold on a minute. Hold on. I have an announcement. Me and Diane, uh... we decided we're going to get married.
answer: But not before... I have our baby. ... so when your dad said, "I never want to see your "f-'in' faces again!" do you think he meant forever or just until your mom wakes up?

question: I don't know... And what the hell was that sound she made right before she hit the coffee table.
answer: Well, if I had to guess... I'd say that was the sound of a mother saying good-bye to her little boy and hello to a young man who's going to be a daddy of his own... Jack, do you know what I see here?

question: Spit from your dad?
answer: I see a flower. And y'know, even the most beautiful flowers still grow from dirt.

question: Yeah.
answer: So, while we're knee deep in right now - and things seem pretty "stinky" - in the long run, we're going to grow strong from this.

question: Y'think?
answer: I sure do.

question: Diane, I've loved you ever since I first saw you -- right before you kicked me in the head.
answer: Oh, Jack...

question: I'm sorry.
answer: What?! But all our paperwork's there. My school records, Jack's football records...

question: Let me explain something...
answer: No. Wait! Did I say Promise! Cross-my heart and hope-to-die, stick-a-needle-in my-eye we'll never miss a payment?!

question: Uh, yes. Yes you did.
answer: Diane. Hold on a minute. I think I know where this is going. I'm willing to put up the papers for my Mustang - she's got a few miles on her, but she looks great.

question: I'm sure, son, but --
answer: Okay! Stop twisting my arm! I'll throw in the speakers.

question: Welcome to Burger Bin. Don't get the Filet-O-Fish - the fry cook picks his ass. Two Taco Grannnndes, one burrrrrrito, large ta-co chips and guacamooooooole... We don't really have fried rats in the buckets - I know, I checked. That'll be...uh, thirty five cents, please. Welcome to Dinkie's Donuts. Dinkie is a bad, bad man... Y'know what? I'll save you the time. I'm not going to lie. I don't believe in it. If you pick your ass - I'm going to tell people. I have no idea how to run your registers. And, if any of you are hard core drinkers and like to throw knives, well, I'm outta here right now.
answer: Uh, are, uh, you-you're Jack Bartlett, right?

question: Yeah.
answer: You'd be, like, hangin' out with us every night after school, right?

question: Yeah - well, after football practice.
answer: You're hired!

question: I'm on top of the world! Hey, Di, if we have a girl, we should dress her like Little Debbie!
answer: Jack, sweetie, I'm only eating for two.

question: But Di, all this food reminds me of how much I want to teach our baby. Like Cocoa Puffs. Good. Captain Crunch. Bad. Shreds the roof of your mouth. I mean you hear, "Tricks are for kids!" And you think, "I'm a kid, I guess they're for me." But your baby brain's got no idea that Fruit Loops are, like, a million times better. I'm going to save our kid all that pain.
answer: Jack...

question: If you could be Count Chocula, Frankenberry or Trix the Rabbit, who'd you be?
answer: Trix...

question: Me too! Will it ever end?! I love this lady!
answer: Jack, I think I should get a job.

question: But we agreed your job is running the baby machine...
answer: I know, but that was before.

question: Ah! I almost forgot gas for the baby machine. I'll grab your Snickers and get a place in line. Hey, Di! Hello, I'm the little professor. Wouldn't it be cute if ours looked like this?! I never knew you dreamed of working in a grocery store bank branch. Baby, we are living the great American Dream!
answer: Mmm-hmmm... If you reach for the stars, you're bound to get -- mm-Jack, pull over.

question: You sure I'm not fat?
answer: Look, you're fat, Diane. You're fat, fat, fat! Because you eat, eat, eat! What?! She keeps asking because she wants some honesty.

question: No I don't... I keep asking because I feel fat.
answer: Oh G-d, I'm sorry... You're not really fat! I was just saying that because, uh, I thought that's what you wanted me to say.

question: You sure?
answer: Positive.

question: "Positive" you're sure I'm not fat or "positive" I'm...
answer: Oh my G-d, I read about this! It's called a "pregnancy insanity." Quick, she needs a sitz bath --

question: Lucy, do you know for sure you're going to get that scholarship?
answer: No.

question: If you don't - can you still afford to go to Harvard?
answer: ... I don't know. Probably not.

question: So then this isn't crazy. It's a sure bet.
answer: Well... I guess we're in this together. But, we have to make a smart plan!

question: I'm sorry, Diane, but I'm not gonna watch my dreams fade away 'cause the Virgin Mary here thinks she's gonna get ideas from kiddie movies --
answer: Those of us who have parents, know that they have rules because they care!

question: You sure you wanna go there?
answer: Uh...maybe?

question: Grandma and Grandpa sent you pictures of a neighbor girl. They didn't want you to break out and come kidnap me.
answer: Thank G-d. I was starting to think I'd killed the wrong man.

question: You shouldn't smoke so many of those.
answer: I know, but it keeps down the size of my can.

question: They could kill you.
answer: So could half the women in here. And I'd rather go out with a nice can... So watcha here for? To say how much you hate me or how much your grandparents hate me...

question: I don't hate you. I need your help.
answer: My what?

question: Your help.
answer: Now how the hell can I help you?

question: Okay, you can't tell anybody.
answer: Gee, I'll sit out this afternoon's coffee talk. Whaddya want?

question: My best friend got pregnant.
answer: Before you? Whoo-hoo!

question: I know - that's what I said too. Anyway, we want to help her get some money for the baby by robbing a bank.
answer: Well, shit-fire, Kansas, that's the sweetest goddamn thing ever...

question: I know, but we can't quite figure out how to, y'know, do it.
answer: So you need my help? Oh my G-d, this is like asking me for help with your homework. Hey, Mink, c'mere! Kansas, I want you to meet someone special.

question: Oh, Jesus Christ, Mom! Like my life ain't a great big pile-of-shit 'cause you're in here? Now I have to add, "P.S. My mom's a dyke" too?
answer: What?! Hush up, you mouthy little shit!

question: Hey, don't "mouthy shit" me - I'm outta here.
answer: Wait, Petunia. Mommy's a little amped up - didn't get her yard time this morning. Mink ain't my bitch. She's a specialist... in banks.

question: Really...
answer: Yeah. "Itchy" sent us.

question: She did, did she? How is the old girl?
answer: Definitely old.

question: That's Itchy, alright. How many y'need?
answer: Well, we'll each probably want one - so let's make it five. Five should do it.

question: Okay. How much ammo you reckon you'll need?
answer: Ammo?

question: Bullets.
answer: Bullets? No bullets! Oh my gosh, these are just to scare people. Kinda like round-off, back handspring, whip back, double full. You never really use it - you just want the opposing squad to know you've got it.

question: You have three heart attacks and a half dozen strokes and tell me how much you wanna run up and down the stairs. Shit - I forgot to pick up the cigarettes.
answer: Ready? Okay!

question: What the hell?
answer: Oh no...

question: Screw Lucy!
answer: Kansas? Is that you down there?

question: Shit! Yeah, Grandma. Me and the squad.
answer: Are you girls talking about boys? Practicing kissing your hands?

question: Oh yeah, you caught us...
answer: Oh well, then I'll put some cookies at the top of the stairs for you gals.

question: Thanks! That'd be great.
answer: You got that big retarded girl down there?

question: Uh...Yeah, Grandma. She doesn't mean that. Kinda lost the old filter with her last stroke.
answer: Then I'll throw a few more treats on the plate. Where's my smokes?

question: I'll get them before "Touched by an Angel," don't worry.
answer: You damn well better...

question: Who are you - the goddamn Bionic Woman?!
answer: I just pulled and it - it came off.

question: This is great - GREAT! Now we have to enter the front door!
answer: Look, it's really not my fault.

question: Hey! Rule number one - never take off the mask! Y'hear me! No matter what happens, NEVER TAKE OFF THE MASK!
answer: Sorry, Kansas...

question: NO-GAH-BUH- NO! Rule number two - NO NAMES! NO GODDAMN NAMES, you retard!
answer: Oh for Chrissakes... "White trash Betty." I didn't realize the rules went into effect before we entered Safeway.

question: Okay, down on the ground! Now! I said DOWN! BANK! All of you!
answer: Bank branch!

question: Bank branch!
answer: All of you!

question: they're freaking out.
answer: yelling and running. SUDDENLY, the SOUND OF TEN ROUNDS in TWO SECONDS breaks the tension. MOTION SLOWS as his hat EXPLODES OFF HIS HEAD. His face registers absolute surprise as he falls back on his ass.

question: Hannah stands frozen, gun still at her shoulder, breathing hard. All turn - SHE JUST SHOT A GUY!
answer: spread eagle in the middle of the demolished aisle. Cereal trickles down from punctured boxes on the shelves.

question: It was Lucy! Lucy went to the cops!
answer: Remember, Kansas, every time you point a finger you've got three more pointing back at you.

question: She's been the weak tit on this mama cat since the beginning. That you?
answer: Yeah, hold on.

question: Just call me later. I gotta get some smokes for Grandma.
answer: Don't use big bills!

question: Hello?
answer: We're dead! They showed this prison movie to my youth group on Sunday.

question: Hannah, we've...
answer: It wasn't like the prison we saw - all these women had to shave their heads because they got lice from the filthy lives they'd lived! Oh G-d, I'm gonna be someone's bald bitch!

question: Hold on...
answer: with

question: Yeah? Hello? No. This is Diane. I think you have the wrong number. Ooops, that's me -- gotta run!
answer: with

question: Hey guys. Someone not take a shower today?
answer: Hey Lisa, did you run into Carmen Electra last summer?

question: No.
answer: Oh. 'Cause is looks like you got some of her tits in you...
